channel.title: Why do people hate Noble Meta?
channel.description:
I mean, it's good confirmation for:
Knights on the king (Knight is already a hard class to prove as) Healers so that you don't have to confirm them with heals until very later. Princesses who use Will-o-Whisp on king. Nobles who confirm this. Any investigative that get redirected to the king
This by itself is already 5 ways it can confirm people.
And if a sell sword is on the king, bam. Proven SS ingame and anyone who was on the king is probably good.

item.title: Why do people hate Noble Meta?
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
ah that is a good point I did not realize

Read full topic

item.title: Why do people hate Noble Meta?
item.dc:creator: Kape
item.description:
As someone who has faked Noble a fair amount of times, faking your n1 Gossip is very easy thanks to the Gossip Meta.

Read full topic
item.source: Why do people hate Noble Meta?

item.title: Why do people hate Noble Meta?
item.dc:creator: Arete
item.description:
Basically, your fake gossip will last for as long as no one disputes it – so if I put N1 - Gossip 1 - 1xprot, 2xDNR, 1xDND, and there are two knights, they’ll both think ‘Okay, I was on the king, so that’s correct.’

Read full topic
item.source: Why do people hate Noble Meta?

item.title: Why do people hate Noble Meta?
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
oh yeah I agree twin is cheese … practically an exploit

i was just talking about gossip. now i do agree gossip is way easier to fake than follow. actually follow would be unimaginably more difficult. but faking the n1 gossip would still be too difficult to actually do, maybe you could get a trade with it but it’s not like you can reliably correctly guess the number of healers, chronos, and knights on king n1 to “confirm” yourself

however that said i see your point now that the twin to distinguish real from fake gossips is game breaking

Read full topic
item.source: Why do people hate Noble Meta?

item.title: Why do people hate Noble Meta?
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Kape:

So the issue lies with Twin being a confirmation button

An issue. Not THE issue.

item.source: Why do people hate Noble Meta?

item.title: Why do people hate Noble Meta?
item.dc:creator: Kape
item.description:
You CAN fake a Gossip to confirm your whole scum team.
You CAN’T fake a Twin to confirm your gossip.

So the issue lies with Twin being a confirmation button.

Read full topic

item.title: Why do people hate Noble Meta?
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
kylundstrom92:

I don’t like the idea of every single defensive in the game piled on one particular person.

Worst part is.

It’s the one person who is guaranteed to be able to defend themselves. And it’s possibly the evil that is most likely to be killed by other evils.

Read full topic
item.source: Why do people hate Noble Meta?

item.title: Why do people hate Noble Meta?
item.dc:creator: kylundstrom92
item.description:
I hate the noble on king and all healers on king meta for a different reason than most. I don’t like how it encourages bd to leave everyone but king open to not get heals. I don’t like the idea of every single defensive in the game piled on one particular person.

Read full topic

item.source: Why do people hate Noble Meta?

item.title: Why do people hate Noble Meta?
item.dc:creator: DeathReaperRH
item.description:
The Noble Meta only really matters when the noble is half decent.
Its a social class so they’re supposed to talk. If a Noble is completely silent sure you confirm them with the noble twin but they have to be aggressive. I was just in a game with a noble who didn’t claim or confirm anybody and got REKT because when I(as hunter) asked for his class twice on both days he didn’t reply.
That said if the Noble is really good then it feels oppressive. Its entire class can confirm so many people. And if the noble is willing to share that information can really help BD make the right decisions in trying to scum read.

Read full topic
item.source: Why do people hate Noble Meta?

item.source: Why do people hate Noble Meta?

item.title: Why do people hate Noble Meta?
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
not therefore.

Effectiveness and fun are not directly correlated. Although they do share common variables.

Meta’s form because they are effective. Many meta’s are unfun such as the whisper claim meta’s and now noble meta.

Others are fine, such as log formatting and the optimal reaction to an outed prince.

And others still are debated to this day such as VFR.

Generally the unfun meta’s are the ones that disallow players to make unique plays on either side. But since restricting what moves that scum can do tends to be a good idea Meta’s that go against that form. Not all meta’s are like that and so they aren’t all bad, but the good one’s don’t get talked about because no one complains about them.

This is all highly subjective, but just understand that while effectiveness CAN be unfun doesn’t mean it’s NECESSARILY unfun. But when it does people notice and it sucks.

Read full topic
item.source: Why do people hate Noble Meta?

You’re right. But Noble meta is more effective therefore it’s bad in terms of fun.
